column3: str

Vuyargur wishes for there to be light.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Speak with the Yok Huy mountaineer in Solace.
Deliver the restoration glowstone to Vuyargur.
We Yok Huy use glowstone as a source of light in our homes, and we wish to employ it at the altar as well.
As the stone lies deep in the earth alongside fossilized matter, however, we must rely on seasoned mountaineers for its location and excavation.
I have tasked one such individual with the work to the north of Worlar's Echo. Might I trouble you to pay him a visit to see if he has found anything for us?
I have tasked our mountaineer with excavating glowstone again. Might I trouble you to pay him another visit to see if he has found anything for us?
As before, he should be performing his work to the north of Worlar's Echo. The way can be treacherous, so do take care with your footing.
Vuyargur sent you to collect the glowstone, did he? Here, take this.
That there is an exceptionally pure example, far rarer than what was requested and laborious to find. But in view of your efforts to restore peace to our land, I render it up gladly.
Ah, it's you again. Here for the glowstone, I take it. You may take this with you.
Should Vuyargur require more, I should be glad to provide. These old bones may creak more than they used to, but I consider it my little way of contributing to the cause.
I am counting on your success─we all are.
Did the mountaineer have glowstone for us?
Well now, this is a fine specimen indeed, of a quality befitting ceremonial use. It is very generous of him to yield such.
Perhaps you already know this, but we Yok Huy have a ritual whereby we prolong the radiance of glowstone by sprinkling it with saltwater imbued with prayers.
We Yok Huy have a tradition whereby we prolong the radiance of glowstone by sprinkling it with saltwater imbued with prayers.
Those prayers harbor the desire for our lives to endure in serenity, like the stone's gentle glow.
I shall pray for the same as I put this glowstone to use in our work. My thanks for the delivery, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.
